content: Could someone give advice on how to please the classical_decidable linter? The proofs don't work anymore if I follow the linter and replace decidable_eq by classical in the proof. The proof stops at something whose proof should be refl, but is not. I also tried congr' which also failed, but I had not used it before, so might have done something wrong.
Can you give a precise example of a theorem which the linter is not happy with?
I had a PR accepted yesterday which was just the changing of a * to a u. It fixed an issue with a lemma having suboptimal universe parameters
Could someone have a look at this PR, the last relevant commit is from 4 days ago (only a merge master since then)?
Thanks for the ping. I left some minor comments, but I think this looks good overall
Thanks a lot for the fast reply. Comments adressed.
@Julian Külshammer I just noticed that a couple of subproofs were indented a bit too much
